intro: Aulotandra trigonocarpa, commonly known as the three-angled fruit tree, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its trifoliate leaves and yellowish flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruit is a woody, three-angled capsule that contains small, round seeds. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
